subject: South African Sign Language Home Language P3

groups.title: SECTION A: ESSAY
groups.instructions: Sign an essay of 4–6 minutes on ONE of the following topics. Sign the NUMBER and TITLE/HEADING of your essay. The NUMBER and TITLE/HEADING of your essay must match.

questions.text:
THAT THAT DISASTER BAD-VERY 

It was a complete disaster!

PERSON THAT-THAT ME KNOW-NOT ME HELP 
LIFE MY CHANGE

Helping a stranger changed my life forever.

DECISION THIS MINE
DO 

If it was my decision, I would ...

HOME STUDY WORK
TECHNOLOGY WOW SUPPORT 

Technology has supported studying and working from home.

WIFI W-I-F-I 
STUDENT UNIVERSITY SCHOOL CHILDREN BOTH PAY MUST 

Should Wi-Fi be free for learners and students?

The pictures on the screen may evoke a particular reaction or feeling. Look at the three pictures that follow and select ONE picture. Think about the picture, then plan and sign an essay in response. Sign the question number of your choice and give your essay a title.

NOTE: There must be a clear link between the essay and the picture that you have chosen.

PICTURE BELOW OWN SIGN
PICTURE THREE BELOW
YOU ONE CHOOSE SIGN
YOU BRAINSTORM STRUCTURE PLAN MUST
TOPIC SIGN NUMBER SIGN
PICTURE ESSAY MATCH MUST
A silhouette of one person reaching down from a higher rocky ledge to help pull another person up the slope.
A close-up photograph of a hummingbird and several bees gathered around a small water source.
A photograph of a small green plant sprout emerging through a large crack in dry, parched earth.

groups.title: SECTION B: TRANSACTIONAL TEXTS
groups.instructions: Select TWO of the following topics. The length of your presentation should be 2–3 minutes. Sign the NUMBER and TITLE of the text you have chosen. The NUMBER and TITLE of the text you have chosen must match. Pay careful attention to the following: Audience and register, Language structure and fluency

questions.text:
INFORMAL PRESENTATION 

LUNCH GATHERING 
DEPARTMENT SPORTS ART CULTURE AUDIENCE
YOU SIGN WHAT
DEAF INCLUDE

The Department of Sports, Arts and Culture is hosting a lunchtime imbizo. Prepare a presentation on Deaf inclusion.

VOTE OF THANKS

COMMUNITY YOUR
PEOPLE PENSION HERE
HOME THEIR
DOCTOR GO-TO GO-TO HELP-THEM 
YOU SIGN THANK YOU

A doctor in your community is visiting pensioners at their homes. Sign a thank-you note addressed to the doctor.

FORMAL REPORT

PLACE TOWN YOURS BEFORE DANGEROUS
BUSINESS OPPORTUNITY NO
NOW CHANGE
YOU CONTACT EXPLAIN HOW CHANGE 
MONEY GIVE-TOWN

An area in your town is not receiving business opportunities due to being a high-risk area. Sign a formal report to a group of investors explaining the transformation that has taken place.

REQUEST

COMPANY YOU WORK THERE
YOU BURSARY WANT WHY UNIVERSITY GO 
MOTIVATE BURSARY-GIVE-YOU 

You are working for a company that sponsors university students. Sign a request to motivate why you should be the recipient.

CONGRATULATORY MESSAGE

SOUTH AFRICA DEAF STUDENT TOP
YOU SIGN CONGRATULATION 

Sign a congratulatory message to the top Deaf student in South Africa.

NEWS ITEM

TOWN YOURS PERSON VERY-IMPORTANT DIE
YOU TV SIGN TRIBUTE 

A prominent member of your town has passed away. Prepare a tribute for TV news.
